channel.title: Buffered writer question

item.title: Buffered writer question
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

lol lil confused here

how would i make it so the reader can tell that it isOn is on ?

[code] try {

while(isOn = true) {
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("config/BackGroundFlip.txt"));
String data = null;

    aRSImageProducer_1110.initDrawingArea();
    sprite.method346(382, 0);
    aRSImageProducer_1111.initDrawingArea();
    sprite.method346(-255, 0);
    aRSImageProducer_1107.initDrawingArea();
    sprite.method346(254, 0);
    aRSImageProducer_1108.initDrawingArea();
    sprite.method346(180, -371);
    aRSImageProducer_1109.initDrawingArea();
    sprite.method346(180, -171);
    aRSImageProducer_1112.initDrawingArea();
    sprite.method346(382, -265);
    aRSImageProducer_1113.initDrawingArea();
    sprite.method346(-180, -265);
    aRSImageProducer_1114.initDrawingArea();
    sprite.method346(254, -171);
    aRSImageProducer_1115.initDrawingArea();
}
}
catch(Exception _ex) {}[/[/code]

item.title: Buffered writer question
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

i was thinking how i would make a buffered writer use a boolean like

if(!boolean) { bufferedwriter w\e... on; } if(boolean) { bufferedwriter w\e... off; }

get my idea?
if anyone can help id thank you very much

anyways the main reason i want to know this is because im making a client that wil read alot of features from text files
like
ip
background image
flames on/off
rs logo on/off
and some others
